Tucson looks to Windlord with a sigh of relief.  He was happy to have Talon=
 back safe at the Ark.  He then takes a moment to collect his thoughts.

" =
Let Talon know that she is more than welcome to join us here in the ready r=
oom.  And as far as what to expect, I'm not sure but we should keep a bodyg=
uard with Nightlight and Elita.  They must not leave the Ark until I deem i=
t safe to do so. " 

He leans up against the wall, watching the computer mo=
dels carefully.

" There is no easy way around this situation, we're all in=
 for a tough road ahead.  Now, I am not going to force anyone into anything=
, I will allow everyone to make a choice that best suits them and the missi=
on at hand.  And whatever they wish to do is alright with me."

Something n=
udged at his logic system what would make someone vanish off the ends of th=
e Earth without a trace?  Then the answer his him and it hits hard.  

" Sp=
ace bridge....."

He turns his head sharply to Leo Prime.

"Leo, I think I =
know what could have happened to Optimus Primal.
Only a space bridge would =
be capable of causing a strange disappearances as what happened to Primal. =
 Perhaps a bridge with a time rift component. I wonder... Scan for rift act=
ivity, I don't know for sure but that's what it looks like."



Perpetually=
 on the move and constantly busy. 

On Aug 27, 2011, at 5:43 PM, Airshadow =
Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Windlord:
>  
> Windlord arrive=
d at the place and said at Tucson"Sir, Talon has arrived at the base; Also =
I would like to know what measures woulb be taken in order to avoid dark Ro=
dimus to lure out the basee at Nighlight and Elita"

> 
> Tucson narrows an opt=
ic with a clearing of his throat, to get the attention of everyone in the r=
oom.  
> 
> " Thank you Leo, I can explain things from here.  Of course I w=
ill not be sending everyone into the fray, I only intend to send those who =
wish to fight, onto the physical field.  Those who wish to monitor the Ark,=
 are free to do so.  We will use a method of command both here and at the p=
rojected site.  I for one am willing to go and look for Rodimus and Cyclonu=
s.  I will back you three   up from the sky, just in case an ambush does in=
deed follow you."
> 
> Straight Shot nods.
> 
> " Sounds fair ta me.  Rattr=
ap has a better nose for trouble than I do and Wheelie has the best field s=
kills out of all of us."
> 
> Rattrap nods.
> 
> " That's right, and Prickl=
es has some pretty fancy aim.  We can swing the recon part no problemo .  B=
ut like Leo said, only use it if we gotta defend ourselves and not ta throw=
 the first punch."
> 
> Tucson could already see that the three of them wou=
ld be a good fit, just by how they expressed their views.  It made him smil=
e.
> 
> " See?  It's not so bad is it?  Here you are putting your heads tog=
ether instead  of against each other.  Remember, look out for yourselves an=
d if something is way over your head, please call for help.  It isn't worth=
 risking your lives just to try and do something on your own."
> 
> He turn=
s to Leo Prime.
> 
> " That goes for you as well.  Don't take on more than =
you can handle.  Now, let's meet with everyone and see who wants to stay an=
d who wishes to venture out."
> 
> Perpetually on the move and constantly b=
usy. 
>

.com> wrote:

> > There was a nod from Wheelie, "I find=
 I must say, I would prefer to stay in
> > the Ark this day. For I fear wha=
t we will see when all away. There may be
> > another power at play, here t=
o come while we are out today. I nkow that if
> > we spread ourselves to th=
in, someone could come here and the war they couyld
> > win. There is more =
than we know going on, I do not like it, we do not
> > belong. I fear we ma=
y find something we do not know, and we shall not like
> > to go."
> >
> > =
At this point, nodding up over and readyign to go out in the portion of the=

> > grid wher ehte trio had been dispatched to patrol. Not so much a sense=
 of
> > fear in him.. But hesitation.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> "You present a good p=
oint Wheelie." LEO said, looking at him with an
> appraising optic. "You sp=
eak with a greater wisdom then you let on."
> There was a small smile as LE=
O spoke. "All of us will not be going,
> only some of us, you are right the=
 Ark will need to be protected.
> 
> LEO PRIME looked over at TUSCON but co=
ntinued to speak for the benefit
> of all. "I do not know how many Tuscon p=
lans to bring, but I would
> *suggest* leaving Legacy, Lord Elder as well a=
s Bump. Santon can act
> as a field doctor with the group going out."
> 
> =
There was a slight shrug, "I will warn you though, Santon, like many
> medi=
cs, will not take a life or even have any desire to enter combat."
>

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Tucson looks to Windlord with a sigh o=
f relief.  He was happy to have Talon back safe at the Ark.  He t=
hen takes a moment to collect his thoughts.</div><div><br></div><div>" Let =
Talon know that she is more than welcome to join us here in the ready room.=
  And as far as what to expect, I'm not sure but we should keep a body=
guard with Nightlight and Elita.  They must not leave the Ark until I =
deem it safe to do so. " </div><div><br></div><div>He leans up against=
 the wall, watching the computer models carefully.</div><div><br></div><div=
>" There is no easy way around this situation, we're all in for a tough roa=
d ahead.  Now, I am not going to force anyone into anything, I will al=
low everyone to make a choice that best suits them and the mission at hand.=
  And whatever they wish to do is alright with me."</div><div><br></di=
v><div>Something nudged at his logic system what would make someone vanish =
off the ends of the Earth without a trace?  Then the answer his him an=
d it hits hard.  </div><div><br></div><div>" Space bridge....."</div><=
div><br></div><div>He turns his head sharply to Leo Prime.</div><div><br></=
div><div>"Leo, I think I know what could have happened to Optimus Primal.</=
div><div>Only a space bridge would be capable of causing a strange disappea=
rances as what happened to Primal.  Perhaps a bridge with a time rift =
component. I wonder... Scan for rift activity, I don't know for sure but th=
at's what it looks like."</div><div><br></div><div><br></div><div><br>Perpe=

<div>Tucson narrows an optic with =

e.  Of course I will not be sending everyone into the fray, I only int=
end to send those who wish to fight, onto the physical field.  Those w=
ho wish to monitor the Ark, are free to do so.  We will use a method o=
f command both here and at the projected site.  I for one am willing t=
o go and look for Rodimus and Cyclonus.  I will back you three   =
up from the sky, just in case an ambush does indeed follow you."</div><div>=

a me.  Rattrap has a better nose for trouble than I do and Wheelie has=

nods.</div><div><br></div><div>" That's right, and Prickles has some pretty=
 fancy aim.  We can swing the recon part no problemo .  But like =
Leo said, only use it if we gotta defend ourselves and not ta throw the fir=
st punch."</div><div><br></div><div>Tucson could already see that the three=

st each other.  Remember, look out for yourselves and if something is =
way over your head, please call for help.  It isn't worth risking your=

> There was a nod from Wheelie, "I find I must say, I wou=
ld prefer to stay in<br>
> the Ark this day.  For I fear what we will se=
e when all away.  There may be<br>
> another power at play, here to come=
 while we are out today.  I nkow that if<br>
> we spread ourselves to th=
in, someone could come here and the war they couyld<br>
> win.  There is=
 more than we know going on, I do not like it, we do not<br>
> belong.  =
I fear we may find something we do not know, and we shall not like<br>
>=
 to go."<br>
><br>
> At this point, nodding up over and readyign to g=
o out in the portion of the<br>
> grid wher ehte trio had been dispatche=
d to patrol.  Not so much a sense of<br>
> fear in him..  But hesitation=
.<br>

<NEW><br>
<br>
"You present a good point Wheelie." LEO sai=
d, looking at him with an<br>
appraising optic. "You speak with a greater w=
isdom then you let on."<br>
There was a small smile as LEO spoke. "All of u=
s will not be going,<br>
only some of us, you are right the Ark will need t=
o be protected.<br>
<br>
LEO PRIME looked over at TUSCON but continued to s=
peak for the benefit<br>
of all. "I do not know how many Tuscon plans to br=
ing, but I would<br>
*suggest* leaving Legacy, Lord Elder as well as Bump. =
Santon can act<br>
as a field doctor with the group going out."<br>
<br>
Th=
ere was a slight shrug, "I will warn you though, Santon, like many<br>
medi=
cs, will not take a life or even have any desire to enter combat."<br>
